Welcome to TwitterAPI’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class TwitterAPI.TwitterAPI(consumer_key, consumer_secret, access_token_key, access_token_secret)¶

Access REST API or Streaming API resources.

request(resource, params=None)¶

Request a resource from Twitter

Parameters:
  • resource – A string with the resource path (ex. search/tweets)
  • params – A dict of resource parameters
Returns:

A TwitterResponse object
class TwitterAPI.TwitterOAuth(consumer_key, consumer_secret, access_token_key, access_token_secret)¶

A container for Twitter’s OAuth credentials

classmethod read_file(file_name=None)¶

Read OAuth credentials from a text file

Parameters:file_name – A string with the file name
class TwitterAPI.TwitterRestPager(api, resource, params=None)¶

Pagination iterator for REST API resources

get_iterator(wait=5, new_tweets=False)¶

Gets an iterator for the data returned by Twitter

Parameters:
  • wait – An integer number of seconds wait between requests (depending on the resource, appropriate values are 5 or 60 seconds)
  • new_tweets – A bool determining the search direction (False: old results, True: current results)
Returns:

A JSON object representing the return value
class TwitterAPI.TwitterResponse(response, stream)¶

Response returned by TwitterAPI.request()

get_iterator()¶

Gets an iterator for the data returned by Twitter

Returns:Either a StreamingIterator or a RestIterator object
get_rest_quota()¶

Gets API quota from the response header of a REST API call

Returns:A dict containing the number of calls remaining
status_code None¶

A property containing HTTP status code returned by Twitter

Returns:An integer, 200 when no error
text None¶

A property containing the data returned by Twitter

Returns:A UTF-8 string with the raw text response
class TwitterAPI.RestIterator(response)¶

Iterator of REST API response data

class TwitterAPI.StreamingIterator(response)¶

Iterator of Streaming API response data
